com.percolate.android.utils

Class DialogUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.percolate.android.utils.DialogUtils

  • public class DialogUtils
extends java.lang.Object

    Utility methods used to show a quick pop-up dialog.

    Common uses:

    DialogUtils.quickDialog(this, "Test Message"); //Shows an alert dialog

    • Constructor Summary

      DialogUtils()

    • Method Detail

      • quickDialog

        public static android.app.AlertDialog quickDialog(android.app.Activity context,
                                  java.lang.String message)
        Show a model dialog box. The android.app.AlertDialog object is returned so that you can specify an OnDismissListener (or other listeners) if required. Note: show() is already called on the AlertDialog being returned.
        Parameters:
        context - The current Context or Activity that this method is called from
        message - Message to display in the dialog.
        Returns:
        AlertDialog that is being displayed.

      • closeDialogListener

        public static android.content.DialogInterface.OnClickListener closeDialogListener()
        Simple listener event that closes the current dialog event when fired.
        Returns:
        DialogInterface.OnClickListener that can be attached to a button
